p: Due to different methods used for the evaluation of antioxidant activity of Rh. tomentosum extracts [ 33, 45], it is complicated to compare our results with already published data. Marsh rosemary EO, containing major compounds sabinene, terpinen-4-ol, and myrtenal, strongly reduced DPPH â€¢ formation and exhibited a hydroxyl radical scavenging effect in the deoxyribose system, and it inhibited the nonenzymatic lipid peroxidation of rat liver homogenate [ 33]. It was revealed that Rh. tomentosum extract containing an appreciable content of polyphenols possessed strong antioxidant activity, which was close to that of ascorbic acid [ 45].
